body: A combined force of about 50 police detectives and F.B.I. agents searched yesterday for witnesses and clues in the slayings of the organized-crime leader Paul Castellano and a chief aide, but officials acknowledged little progress in solving the murders. ''Historically, the solution rate for organized-crime murders is not very high,'' said an
title: POLICE SEEK GANG-SLAYING WITNESSES

title: The Results by Voting District in Tuesday's Primary Election

body: The Board of Estimate, rejecting the last-minute appeals of neighborhood residents, gave final city approval yesterday for construction of a garbage-burning incinerator at the old Brooklyn Navy Yard. The incinerator - the first of a network of up to 10 planned across the city at a cost of $2.5 billion - was approved by a 6-to-5 vote after more than
title: APPROVAL IS GIVEN FOR INCINERATOR AT BROOKLYN SITE

body: Scores of New York City residents are having private wells dug this summer for fear that their lawns, shrubbery and flower gardens will die because drought restrictions prohibit them from being watered. The city's Health Department, which issues well permits, reports that it has received about 200 applications this year for residential and
title: NEW YORKERS TURNING TO PRIVATE WELLS IN DROUGHT

body: A 43-year-old Brooklyn doctor has been arrested on charges of selling $24,000 worth of cocaine to undercover detectives, the police said yesterday. The doctor, Mario DeBlasio, a radiologist who lives at 675 Avenue Z in the Gravesend section, was arrested at his home Friday afternoon on charges of possession and sale of a controlled substance, the
title: Doctor Seized on Drug Count

body: The remaining defendant indicted in the fatal beating of a black man by a group of young white men on a Brooklyn street in 1982 pleaded guilty yesterday to an assault charge. The police and prosecutors have said that the 34-year-old victim, William Turks, a transit worker from Queens, and two other black men who were also transit employees were
title: MAN PLEADS GUILTY TO ASSAULT IN BEATING OF BLACKS BY A MOB

body: Following are the scores, released by the New York City Board of Education, on the reading tests given in the city's public elementary schools and junior high schools in April 1984. The center column shows the proportion of pupils in each school reading at or above grade level. The right-hand column gives each school's overall citywide ranking.
title: READING TEST SCORES FOR NEW YORK SCHOOLS
